alert.note: Alert for Kings (Brooklyn); Northern Nassau; Northern Queens; Northwest Suffolk; Southern Nassau; Southern Queens; Southwest Suffolk (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 6:01AM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF KINGS, QUEENS, NASSAU, AND WESTERN SUFFOLK COUNTIES THROUGH 645 AM... At 600 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Howard Beach, or near Rockaway Beach, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Jamaica, Kennedy Airport, Cedarhurst and Atlantic Beach around 605 AM. Valley Stream, Long Beach, Lynbrook, Woodmere and Elmont around 610 AM. Garden City, Oceanside, Baldwin, Manhasset and Little Neck around 615 AM. Freeport, Mineola and Hempstead around 620 AM. Levittown, Massapequa, Westbury, Hicksville, Wantagh and Brookville around 625 AM. Plainview, Syosset, Farmingdale and Oyster Bay around 630 AM. Melville, Woodbury and Cold Spring Harbor around 635 AM. Huntington Station, Deer Park, Huntington and Dix Hills around 640 AM. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Kings (Brooklyn); Northern Nassau; Northern Queens; Northwest Suffolk; Southern Nassau; Southern Queens; Southwest Suffolk
